TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CheckBoxRenderer extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides methods used to render a check box control with or without visual styles. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer> class provides a set of `static` methods that can be used to render a check box control. Rendering a control refers to drawing the user interface of a control. To draw a check box, use one of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer.DrawCheckBox%2A> methods. These methods provide a variety of options, such as drawing text or an image with the check box.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer.DrawCheckBox%2A> will draw the check box with the current visual style. Otherwise, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer.DrawCheckBox%2A> will draw the check box with the classic Windows style. This is useful if you are drawing a custom control that should automatically match the current visual style setting of the operating system.
This class wraps the functionality of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer?displayProperty=nameWithType> that is set to one of the elements exposed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Button.CheckBox?displayProperty=nameWithType> class. For more information, see [Rendering Controls with Visual Styles](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/rendering-controls-with-visual-styles.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to write a custom control that uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer.DrawCheckBox%2A> method to draw a check box that responds to mouse clicks.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer#0](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer/cpp/form1.cpp#0)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer#0](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer/CS/form1.cs#0)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer#0](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer/VB/form1.vb#0)]

## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer.GetGlyphSize%2A> method to determine the bounds of the check box text. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer> class.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool RenderMatchingApplicationState { get; set; }
.property bool RenderMatchingApplicationState
Public Shared Property RenderMatchingApplicationState As Boolean
public: static property bool RenderMatchingApplicationState { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.RenderMatchingApplicationState : bool with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the renderer uses the application state to determine rendering style.
Docs.value: if the application state is used to determine rendering style; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer.RenderMatchingApplicationState%2A> property is `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer> uses the setting from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.RenderWithVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to determine the rendering style. If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer.RenderMatchingApplicationState%2A> is `false`, the renderer will always render using visual styles.
